com.deltadna.android.sdk.helpers

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.deltadna.android.sdk.helpers.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    DeltaDNA runtime setting. Note: default values should be set here or initialised before start() is called.

      • setSessionTimeout

        public void setSessionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the session timeout.

        A timeout of 0 will disable automatic session refreshing.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the session timeout, in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is negative

      • setEngageCacheExpiry

        public Settings setEngageCacheExpiry(int seconds)
        Sets the Engage cache expiry value.

        A value of 0 will disable the Engage cache.

        Parameters:
        seconds - the Engage cache expiry value, in seconds
        Returns:
        this Settings instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if seconds is negative

      • getHttpRequestMaxRetries

        public int getHttpRequestMaxRetries()
        Gets the number of retries to perform when an HTTP request fails.

        Only applies to Collect requests.

        Returns:
        the number of retries

      • setHttpRequestMaxRetries

        public void setHttpRequestMaxRetries(int retries)
        Sets the number of retries to perform when an HTTP request fails. A value of 0 means no retries will be performed.

        Only applies to Collect requests.

        Parameters:
        retries - the number of retries
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the retries is negative

      • isMultipleActionsForEventTriggerEnabled

        public boolean isMultipleActionsForEventTriggerEnabled()
        Gets whether multiple actions should be processed when evaluating Event-Triggers for an event. If true, all applicable actions will be passed to their respective action handler. If false, only the first applicable parameter will be passed to the respective action handler. N.b. Even when true, Only the first image action will be handled; but this will not stop any subsequent parameter actions from being handled.
        Returns:
        whether multiple actions per event-trigger are enabled.

      • setMultipleActionsForEventTriggerEnabled

        public void setMultipleActionsForEventTriggerEnabled(boolean multipleActionsForEventTriggerEnabled)
        Sets whether multiple actions should be processed when evaluating Event-Triggers for an event. If true, all applicable actions will be passed to their respective action handler. If false, only the first applicable parameter will be passed to the respective action handler. N.b. Even when true, Only the first image action will be handled; but this will not stop any subsequent parameter actions from being handled.

      • getDefaultImageMessageHandler

        public EventActionHandler.ImageMessageHandler getDefaultImageMessageHandler()

      • setDefaultImageMessageHandler

        public void setDefaultImageMessageHandler(EventActionHandler.ImageMessageHandler defaultImageMessageHandler)

      • getHttpRequestConfigTimeout

        public int getHttpRequestConfigTimeout()
        Gets the connection timeout in seconds for Session Configuration HTTP requests.
        Returns:
        the timeout in seconds

      • setHttpRequestConfigTimeout

        public void setHttpRequestConfigTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
        Sets the connection timeout in seconds for Session Configuration HTTP requests.

      • getHttpRequestConfigRetryDelayFactor

        public int getHttpRequestConfigRetryDelayFactor()
        Gets the time factor in seconds between failed Session Configuration HTTP requests. This is used as part of an exponential backoff retry mechanism, e.g. if this was set to 5 seconds, the time before we retry failed config requests would be 5s, 10s, 20s, 40s And so on.
        Returns:
        the factor in seconds

      • setHttpRequestConfigRetryDelayFactor

        public void setHttpRequestConfigRetryDelayFactor(int httpRequestConfigRetryDelayFactor)

      • getHttpRequestConfigMaxRetries

        public int getHttpRequestConfigMaxRetries()
        Gets the number of retries to perform when an Session Configuration HTTP request fails. A value of 0 means no retries will be performed.

        Only applies to Session Configuration requests.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the retries is negative

      • setHttpRequestConfigMaxRetries

        public void setHttpRequestConfigMaxRetries(int httpRequestConfigMaxRetries)
        Sets the number of retries to perform when an Session Configuration HTTP request fails. A value of 0 means no retries will be performed.

        Only applies to Session Configuration requests.

        Parameters:
        httpRequestConfigMaxRetries - the number of retries
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the retries is negative
